learning_outcomes.description: Identify a research topic in the field of WEP or Communication
Plan and carry out research within the field of WEP or Communication
Access, evaluate, and critique primary and secondary sources
Develop an argument critically and clearly
Organise and present written research at a sophisticated level, in a form appropriate to the intended audience

assessments.task_description:
You will write a 10,000-word dissertation on a topic decided in consultation with your supervisor.

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex.  Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance. 

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct. 

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit via Turnitin on Blackboard and email a pdf copy of your dissertation to m.saward@uq.edu.au
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
Workshop one 23/02/2026

Workshop two 2/03/2026

Annotated bibliography 30/03/2026 - 2/04/2026

Draft section one (2500 words) 8/06/2026 - 12/06/2026

Draft section two (2500 words) 3/08/2026 - 7/08/2026

Draft section three (2500 words) 17/08/2026 - 21/08/2026

Draft section four (2500 words) 31/08/2026 - 4/09/2026

Revisions 6/10/2026 - 9/10/2026
assessments.task_description:
The dissertation has 10 milestones to be completed before submission. The Milestones are outlined in the Learning Activities section below.

Each of these milestones is designed to help students progress their projects in a planned and stepped manner.

This is a hurdle assessment, marked Pass/Fail. To pass this course, students must pass this hurdle assessment.

Assessment Outcomes

PASS: Students who participate in at least six of the 10 milestones will receive a PASS for this hurdle requirement and may continue in the course.

FAIL: Students who do not participate in at least six of the 10 milestones will receive a FAIL for this hurdle requirement, resulting in a grade of 1 for the entire course, regardless of performance in the dissertation. If you are at risk of failing the hurdle requirement, you will be invited to a follow-up interview to verify authorship and discuss your work.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
